keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Wiesbaden, Gütersloh and Karlsruhe, Germany, and Beirut, Lebanon; Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut; Maher Samaan from Paris; and Katarina Johanssen from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: In a nation torn between embracing and fearing the migrants who have arrived in the past year, Aeham Ahmad has set himself the task of putting a human face on his fellow arrivals.

headline.print_headline: Syrian Sings to Germans of Sadness, and Hope
headline.main: From Syrian Rubble to German Concert Halls With a Piano, a Mission and Survivor’s Guilt

snippet: In a nation torn between embracing and fearing the migrants who have arrived in the past year, Aeham Ahmad has set himself the task of putting a human face on his fellow arrivals....
abstract: Syrian refugee and pianist Aeham Ahmad has begun performing songs describing plight of his home country on streets of Germany in effort to humanize refuges and ease their integration; Ahmad has expressed ambivalence over effect of his intense and emotional act.
